company.summary: Intel Expressway API Manager, powered by Mashery, helps enterprises to integrate 3rd-party APIs with their own on-prem or cloud based internal data services. This provides enterprise class security, legacy integration, and a more flexible enterprise ready MBaaS platform for the development of mobile applications.  In conjunction, the Intel® HTML5 Development Environment addresses developm
company.details: Intel Expressway API Manager, powered by Mashery, helps enterprises to integrate 3rd-party APIs with their own on-prem or cloud based internal data services. This provides enterprise class security, legacy integration, and a more flexible enterprise ready MBaaS platform for the development of mobile applications.  In conjunction, the Intel® HTML5 Development Environment addresses development cycle challenges with the Intel® XDK - Cross platform development kit enabling “write it once, deploy to many” mobile platforms.. Intel's App Dev center is a cloud-based service that packages HTML5 apps for Apple iOS, Google Android, Amazon Kindle, Facebook, and other App Stores. Intel also provides APIs through its Cloud Services Platform, including location-based, identity, commerce, context, and recommendation services.

company.name: Alcatel-Lucent
company.summary:
Become the Platform
The market for applications is growing exponentially and the time for service providers, enterprises and developers to capitalize on new revenues is now.
Innovative mobile applications that leverage the benefits of the network can give service providers a powerful way to attract and retain subscribers — helping to generate additional income and provide a competitive edge.
company.details:
Become the Platform
The market for applications is growing exponentially and the time for service providers, enterprises and developers to capitalize on new revenues is now.
Innovative mobile applications that leverage the benefits of the network can give service providers a powerful way to attract and retain subscribers — helping to generate additional income and provide a competitive edge. And the opportunity to extend beyond mobile to IPTV, web-based apps, multi-screen, enterprise services etc., offers an even greater opportunity to grow revenue and attract and retain subscribers.
However, the complexity of today's communication and content industries present major obstacles to the creation of new applications. Developers are faced with thousands of devices, hundreds of service providers with varying technical requirements and a rapidly growing community of app stores. In this highly fragmented environment, developers are forced to make tough choices that limit which devices an application can run on, which functions can be provided and which service providers will be targeted.
Ultimately this reduces the market reach and revenue potential that applications can generate for developers, as well as service providers and enterprises, while at the same time seriously limiting choice and flexibility for consumers everywhere.
Service providers, enterprises and application developers alike have an immediate opportunity to reverse the tired, traditional model; leveraging the network as the platform to incite unforeseen levels of collaboration, openness and innovation in our industry.
The Open API Platform offers unique value to both service providers and enterprises interested in innovating on existing assets and establishing a deeper relationship with the developer community.
From Enterprises to Service Providers
The Open API Platform allows service providers to expand their position in the value chain and move beyond the role of "connection provider." Enterprises gain insight into how to best leverage their existing assets and expose them to developer communities in order to stimulate innovation and expand the reach of their brand.
With the Alcatel-Lucent Open API Platform, service providers and enterprises gain a simple framework for exposing their key assets and managing their own developer communities. The Open API Platform enables service providers and enterprises to:

Expose their APIs in the form of REST APIs to make them more easily and widely used by the developer community
Create their own developer programs or supplement their existing ecosystem of developers, content providers and third-party API providers
Collaborate with developers to deliver services that attract and retain subscribers
Earn additional revenue from existing assets. For service providers, these could be network assets such as context and location information, QoS, device and subscriber information, and more. For enterprises, this could be a variety of assets based on the specific industry being served. In retail for example, an extensive product catalog and library might serve as an asset to leverage.

For Developers
The Alcatel-Lucent Open API Platform provides tools that allow developers to collaborate, build, test and distribute new applications for service provider networks. It provides open access to network-based APIs, third party APIs and Alcatel-Lucent APIs (like the new Multi-screen Foundation APIs) to help stimulate the development of new applications that take full advantage of what the network can offer.
Furthermore, our platform provides the critical business tools developers need to manage applications throughout their lifecycle. Our approach helps developers expand the audience for their applications — reaching more service providers, more end users and more devices, with less time, effort and cost.
Expanding the Ecosystem
In June 2010, Alcatel-Lucent acquired ProgrammableWeb, the technology industry's universal source for Web APIs used by application developers to build web, mobile, and other connected applications that serve consumers and the workplace. One month later, in July of 2010, Alcatel-Lucent also acquired OpenPlug, a mobile software and development tools provider. The acquisition of OpenPlug allowed Alcatel-Lucent to deepen its tole in the applications space by delivering, as part of an integrated suite of developer tools, a platform where application developers can write an application once, which will then be translated to run on any of the five major mobile operating systems.
Alcatel-Lucent's aquisition of these companies helps bring together an ecosystem of service providers, enterprises, and developers to drive the creation of unique applications today and in the new world of broadband mobile through LTE.

company.summary: Mashape provides tools that enable developers to quickly deliver and consume APIs and offers a marketplace for listing APIs.  Mashape provides tools for testing your API, code for generation of custom errors, components for user management and standardized API code language libraries in multiple languages.  Once your API is ready for prime time Mashape provides a marketplace for listing
company.details: Mashape provides tools that enable developers to quickly deliver and consume APIs and offers a marketplace for listing APIs.  Mashape provides tools for testing your API, code for generation of custom errors, components for user management and standardized API code language libraries in multiple languages.  Once your API is ready for prime time Mashape provides a marketplace for listing your API, letting developers to easily discover and begin hacking with your API, in a social API community environment.

company.name: Mashery
company.summary:
Mashery is an API management service provider that offers an API as a Software as a Service (SaaS). You can leverage Mashery’s platform to get an API planned, deployed, and into operation quickly. Mashery makes a pretty compelling buy versus build argument when planning for your API.
Mashery provides a wide array of tools in three distinct areas:

API Management building
company.details:
Mashery is an API management service provider that offers an API as a Software as a Service (SaaS). You can leverage Mashery’s platform to get an API planned, deployed, and into operation quickly. Mashery makes a pretty compelling buy versus build argument when planning for your API.
Mashery provides a wide array of tools in three distinct areas:

API Management building blocks like API registration, credential management, usage throttling and business rules.
Metrics and Reporting building blocks like API usage, developer activity, systems status, and real-time insights into API operations.
Community Management building blocks for blogs, wiki, general content management, change control, and forums.

Mashery is definitely the leader in this space. It has a robust set of API management features as well as a service level agreement and extensive API support portal.
Mashery also understands the API developer network to enable deeper integration of their API services.
Mashery’s platform, collective experience, resources, and support makes it enticing to use them as a platform for launching and growing your API.

company.name: Apify
company.summary: Apify is a small and powerful open source library that delivers new levels of developer productivity by simplifying the creation of RESTful architectures. It helps development teams deliver quality web services and applications in reduced amounts of time.  Web services are a great way to extend your application, however, adding a web API to an existing web application can be a tedious and tim
company.details:
Apify is a small and powerful open source library that delivers new levels of developer productivity by simplifying the creation of RESTful architectures. It helps development teams deliver quality web services and applications in reduced amounts of time.  Web services are a great way to extend your application, however, adding a web API to an existing web application can be a tedious and time-consuming task. Apify takes certain common patterns found in most web services and abstract them so that you can quickly write web APIs without having to write too much code.
APIfy aims to help organizations open up APIs to developer communities, in a fast, simple and secure way. APIs promise to help organizations drive new revenue and reach across mobile and cloud. They can also make organizations more responsive to changing customer needs by giving them the data and application access they need, when they need it.
But understanding best practices for opening up APIs to outside communities can be daunting. APIfy distils the lessons from over 10 years of experience gained at Layer 7 Technologies into a simple-to-configure, all-cloud API Management-as-a-Service offering.

company.details:
Apigee is another player in the API management service provider space. Apigee is similar to 3Scale in helping businesses plan, deploy and manage their API.
Apigee provides resources to help you understand best practices, avoid common pitfalls, develop your strategy, and learn to drive your developer community.
Apigee breaks down their product offerings into three tiers:

Free tools to learn test, and debug APIs. Analytics and rate limiting.
Premium tools for advanced rate limiting, key management and unlimited traffic plans.
Enterprise tools for API policy framework, scaling solution for both cloud and on-premise options.

Apigee seems dedicated to a healthy and standards based approach to delivering your API ecosystem with pricing for every budget. Their three tiers of pricing allow you to get your API up and running without a huge budget, and grow as the demand for your API grows.
Apigee also provides articles, white papers, and other resources to help you deliver your API.

company.details: 3Scale provides plug-and-play as well as enterprise level API management services. 3Scale is similar to 3Scale connect is a starter platform with a freemium model for delivering your API. You can deploy at no cost, and pay-as-you-go based upon the volume of calls made on your API. company.details: Beyond the typical API Management Platform, Apiphany offers a true Global API Delivery Platform to their customers. Geared to fit into existing enterprise infrastructure, Apiphany’s team has developed a scalable, flexible cloud-based solution to help companies succeed with their API strategy.  This means Apiphany helps organizations launch, control, and scale their API to meet their evolving needs as well as helps them monitor their API performance and gain insight in their API ecosystem. And finally, Apiphany Global API Delivery Platform supports clients’ efforts to drive developer adoption and build community for their API.

company.name: Atmosphere
company.summary:
Atmosphere provides a secure, platform that companies can deploy to manage their APIs for either a private or public developer community.
The Atmosphere platform gives API providers a management interface to define APIs using a wide range of messaging types and formats including REST/XML, REST/JSON and SOAP.  The platform also provides paging and caching mechanisms to improve app performance.
Atmo
company.details:
Atmosphere provides a secure, platform that companies can deploy to manage their APIs for either a private or public developer community.
The Atmosphere platform gives API providers a management interface to define APIs using a wide range of messaging types and formats including REST/XML, REST/JSON and SOAP.  The platform also provides paging and caching mechanisms to improve app performance.
Atmosphere also provides security capabilities that allow API providers to control and monitor app's usage of the APIs. While also protecting internal applications from overload, as well as provide customers with service-level guarantee through QoS management for SLAs and quotas
These tools for monitoring and managing consumer contracts and traffic can also be applied to enable monetization of APIs.
The Atmosphere API Management can be deployed on-premise or in the cloud, or a combination of the two.  Providing the flexibility and scalability needed by many providers.

It is designed to connect, mediate, and manage interactions between services across the enterprise or in the cloud. If your organization uses internally or externally-facing web services and APIs, cloud-based infrastructure, or service-oriented architecture for your applications, then you will find Sentinet to be a powerful tool, which can be deployed rapidly, and immediately start delivering tangible results.

company.name: Vordel
company.summary: Vordel was born out of a recognition by our founders of the increasingly open and de-perimeterized nature of corporate computing environments. Driven by the adoption of technologies such as XML, REST and SOAP, Vordel identified the need for a means of controlling the increasingly complex and inherently insecure nature of connections across the internet between enterprises. In response Vordel devel
company.details:
Vordel was born out of a recognition by our founders of the increasingly open and de-perimeterized nature of corporate computing environments. Driven by the adoption of technologies such as XML, REST and SOAP, Vordel identified the need for a means of controlling the increasingly complex and inherently insecure nature of connections across the internet between enterprises. In response Vordel developed the world’s first XML firewall in 2002, the precursor to today’s XML Gateway or SOA appliance.
Today, the company’s technology is in its sixth generation and is deployed in some of the world’s largest IT infrastructures. Fortune 500 enterprises and government agencies around the world rely on Vordel's XML Gateway and Cloud Service Broker to increase performance, strengthen security and enhance the interoperability of their SOA and Cloud deployments. With Vordel, companies accelerate their time to benefit from SOA and Cloud and reduce the attendant development and deployment costs. Vordel enables enterprises to govern their service usage and reduce the costs associated with protecting and accelerating their services-based IT environments.

company.name: WSO2
company.summary: WSO2 is the lean enterprise middleware company. It delivers the only complete open source enterprise SOA middleware stack purpose-built as an integrated platform to support today’s heterogeneous enterprise environments internally and in the cloud. WSO2’s service and support team is led by technical experts who have proven success in deploying enterprise SOAs and contribute to the techn
company.details: WSO2 is the lean enterprise middleware company. It delivers the only complete open source enterprise SOA middleware stack purpose-built as an integrated platform to support today’s heterogeneous enterprise environments internally and in the cloud. WSO2’s service and support team is led by technical experts who have proven success in deploying enterprise SOAs and contribute to the technology standards that enable them.

Use a single backend to easily create omni-channel commerce experiences across web, mobile, iOS, Android, TV, social networks, blog, videos, email, ads, voice apps or other connected devices.
